Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::DeleteBlock (  UINT32  block_index  ) 
 

Deletes a block in the storage.

Parameters:
block_index The index of the block in the storage.
Returns:
Whether the operation was successful or not.

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::DeleteBlocks (  UINT32  block_index,
UINT32  count
) 
 

Deletes several blocks in the storage.

Parameters:
block_index The index of the first block to be deleted.
count Number of blocks which shall be deleted.
Returns:
Whether the operation was successful or not.

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::FormatStorage (  UINT16  block_size = c_ram_storage_default_block_size  ) 
 

Formats the storage.

Parameters:
block_size The new size of a block. Default is given by c_ram_storage_default_block_size in RamTypes.hpp.
Returns:
Whether the operation was successful or not.

void HUGE * RamStorageMapper::GetBlock (  UINT32  block_index  )  const [protected]
 

Returns the address of a block with a certain index.

UINT16 RamStorageMapper::GetBlockSize (   )  const
 

Returns the block size of the RamStorageMapper. Default value is defined in c_ram_storage_default_block_size in RamTypes.hpp.

Returns:
Size of one allocation block in bytes.

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::GetFreeBlockIndex (  UINT32 &  block_index  ) 
 

Returns the index of the first unused block in the storage.

Parameters:
block_index A variable the index will be written into.
Returns:
Whether the operation was successful or not. FALSE means that the storage is full.

UINT32 RamStorageMapper::GetFreeSize (   )  const
 

Returns the size of the unused part of the storage.

Returns:
Unused size of the storage in bytes.

static RamStorageMapper* RamStorageMapper::GetInstance (   )  [inline, static]
 

Returns the instance of the Singleton implementation.

Returns:
Pointer to the RamStorageMapper instance.

RamError RamStorageMapper::GetLastError (   )  const
 

Returns the last error which occurred during operations on the storage. The types are defined as enumeration type RamError in RamTypes.hpp.

Returns:
The type of error which occurred in the last operation.

UINT32 RamStorageMapper::GetSize (   )  const
 

Returns the size of the storage.

Returns:
Total size of the storage in bytes.

UINT32 RamStorageMapper::GetUsedSize (   )  const
 

Returns the size of the used part of the storage. Default value is defined in c_ram_storage_default_size in RamTypes.hpp.

Returns:
Used size of the storage in bytes.

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::IsBlockUsed (  UINT32  block_index  )  const
 

Returns whether a specific block is used or not.

Parameters:
block_index The index of any block in the storage.
Returns:
Whether the block is used or not.

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::ReadBlock (  UINT32  block_index,
void HUGE *  block_buffer
) 
 

Reads one block with the specified index into a given buffer.

Parameters:
block_index The index of the block in the storage.
block_buffer Pointer to a buffer. Its allocation and deallocation must be treated by the user.
Returns:
Whether the operation was successful or not.

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::ReadBlocks (  UINT32  block_index,
void HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count
) 
 

Reads several blocks from the storage.

Parameters:
block_index The index of the first block to read.
buffer Buffer to write into. Its allocation and deallocation must be treated by the user.
count Number of blocks which shall be read.
Returns:
Whether the operation was successful or not.

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::WriteBlock (  UINT32  block_index,
const void HUGE *  block_data
) 
 

Writes one block into the storage.

Parameters:
block_index The index of the block in the storage.
block_data Pointer to a buffer containing the data to write into the storage.
Returns:
Whether the operation was successful or not.

BOOLEAN RamStorageMapper::WriteBlocks (  UINT32  block_index,
const void HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count
) 
 

Writes several blocks into the storage.

Parameters:
block_index The index of the first block to be written.
buffer Buffer to read content from. Its allocation and deallocation must be treated by the user.
count Number of blocks which shall be written.
Returns:
Whether the operation was successful or not.
